root.name: Galaxy Game
root.description: Influenced by the design of Spacewar!, designers Bill Pitts and Hugh Tuck developed a dime-operated machine out of a PDP-11 computer with vector graphics.Â The machine resided at Stanford University for nearly 8 years when it was finally decommissioned in May of 1979.It is generally regarded as the first commercial arcade game, although it was ostensibly a unique machine, unlike Nolan Bushnell's Computer Space machine that was to be mass produced and distributed later.
